By the wise Qur'an.
Indeed you, [O Muhammad], are from among the messengers,
On a straight path.
[This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

Already the word has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.

Indeed, within it is concealed the hidden polytheism [shirk khafi] which is more hidden than the crawling of a black ant on a dark night. Yet, nothing hidden remains concealed from this light [nur], nor can any of Satan's stratagems succeed against it. Rather, Satan stands confounded, and he whispers embellished speech as delusion, but no heed is paid to him. And this heart [qalb], after its purification from destructive traits, becomes, in proximity [qurb], inhabited by salvific traits which we will mention: gratitude [shukr], patience [sabr], fear [khawf], hope [raja'], poverty [faqr], asceticism [zuhd], love [mahabba], contentment [rida'], longing [shawq], reliance [tawakkul], reflection [tafakkur], self-reckoning [muhasaba], and others besides. This is the heart upon which God, Mighty and Majestic, has turned His Countenance, and it is the contented heart [al-qalb al-mutma'inn] intended by His saying, Exalted is He: "Is it not in the remembrance of God that hearts find contentment?" and by His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "O contented soul [al-nafs al-mutma'inna]!" The second heart is the forsaken heart [al-qalb al-makhdhul], crammed with caprice [hawa], defiled by blameworthy traits and vile things, its gates opened to the satans and its gates to the angels closed. The origin of evil within it is that a thought [khÄtir] from caprice sparks within it and whispers. The heart then looks to the ruler, the intellect [al-'aql], to seek a legal opinion from it and to discover the face of correctness in the matter. But the intellect has grown accustomed to serving caprice, become intimate with it, and persisted in devising stratagems for it and in aiding caprice. Thus, the soul [al-nafs] gains mastery and assists it. The breast expands with caprice, and its darknesses spread within it due to the withholding of the intellect's army from repelling it. The authority of Satan strengthens due to the expanse of his place caused by the spread of caprice. He turns to it with embellishment, delusion, and false hopes, and he whispers to it embellished speech as delusion. The authority of faith [iman] in the promise and the threat weakens, and the light of certainty [nur al-yaqin] regarding the fear of the Hereafter dims, for a dark smoke ascends from caprice to the heart, filling its corners until its lights are extinguished. The intellect thus becomes like an eye whose eyelids are filled with smoke, unable to see. This is what the dominance of desire [shahwa] does to the heart, until no possibility remains for the heart to pause and gain insight [istibsar]. Even if an admonisher were to show it and make it hear what is true in the matter, it would be blind to understanding and deaf to hearing. Desire rages within it, Satan triumphs, and the limbs move in accordance with caprice. Thus, disobedience [ma'siya] appears from the unseen realm [alam al-ghayb] into the realm of witness [alam al-shahada] by the decree and destiny of God, Exalted is He. To such a heart is the allusion in His saying, Exalted is He: "Have you seen him who takes his caprice as his god? Would you then be a guardian over him?" and "Or do you suppose that most of them hear or understand? They are but like cattle; nay, they are further astray from the way," and in His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "The word has been justified against most of them, for they do not believe," and in His saying: "Alike it is to them whether you warn them or warn them not; they do not believe."

a.g: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -
When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."
They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."
They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,
And we are not responsible except for clear notification."
They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful punishment."
They said, "Your omen is with yourselves. Is it because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."
And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.
Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.
And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?
Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?
Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.
Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."
It was said, "Enter Paradise." He said, "I wish my people could know
Of how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."
And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.
It was not but one shout, and immediately they were extinguished.
How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.
Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them will not return?
And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.
And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.
And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -
That they may eat of His fruit. And their hands have not produced it, so will they not be grateful?
Exalted is He who created all pairs - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j4 k09
Know that everything in existence besides God, the Most High, is the act [fi'l] of God and His creation [khalq]. Every single atom [dharrah] among the atoms, whether substance [jawhar] or accident ['arad], attribute [sifah] or thing described [mawsuf], contains wonders ['aja'ib] and marvels [ghara'ib] through which the wisdom [hikmah] of God, His power [qudrah], His majesty [jalal], and His greatness ['azamah] are made manifest. To enumerate that is not possible, for if the sea were ink for that, the sea would be exhausted before a tenth of its tenth was exhausted. Yet, we point to a summary of it so that it may serve as an example for what lies beyond it. We say: The created existents [mawjudat al-makhluqah] are divided into that whose origin [asl] is not known, so we cannot contemplate [tafakkur] upon it. How many existents are there that we do not know, as God, the Most High, has said: **"And He creates what you do not know."** Glory be to Him Who created all pairs, from what the earth grows and from themselves and from what they do not know. And He said: **"And We will develop you into what you do not know."** And into that whose origin and totality [jumlatiha] are known, but whose details [tafsil] are not known, so we can contemplate upon its details. And it is divided into what we perceive [nadrikuhu] by the sense of sight [hass al-basar], and into what we do not perceive by sight. The closest thing to you is your own self [nafs]. And within you are wonders ['aja'ib] pointing to the greatness ['azamah] of God, the Most High, that lifetimes would end before standing upon a tenth of its tenth, while you are heedless [ghafil] of it. So O you who are heedless of your own self and ignorant [jahil] of it, how do you aspire to know other than yourself? And God, the Most High, has commanded you to reflect [tadabbur] upon your self in His Mighty Book, saying: **"And in yourselves. Then will you not see?"** And He reminded that you are created from a foul sperm-drop, saying: **"Destroyed is man; how disbelieving he is. From what thing did He create him?"**

For if it is presented to them that these effects occur following the course of the planets, it settles in their souls [nufus] that the planets are the effectors and that they are the gods [alihah] managing affairs, because they are noble, celestial substances [jawhar], and their impact is great upon the hearts [qulub]. So these people, when they supposed they were employed for the sake of the poor and the needyâ€”exalted is Godâ€”and then said, "We have no share in the poor, and God has no share in us or in our wealth, whether we spend or withhold," they were destroyed. Just as the child was destroyed when he supposed the parent's purpose in employing him was for the sake of the servants, and he was not aware that the intended purpose was the establishment of the attribute of knowledge [sifat al-'ilm] in his soul and its firm rooting in his heart [qalb], so that this would be the cause of his felicity [sa'ada] in this world [dunya]. He is gazing with his sight towards the Throne, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow the First Blast. When he blows, all in the heavens and the earth are struck downâ€”meaning every living creature dies from the intensity of the terrorâ€”except whom Allah wills, and that is Jibril, Mika'il, Israfil, and the Angel of Death. Then the Angel of Death is commanded to take the soul [ruh] of Jibril, then the soul of Mika'il, then the soul of Israfil. Then the Angel of Death is commanded, and he dies. Then the creation remains after the First Blast in the Barzakh for forty years. Then Allah, the Exalted, revives Israfil and commands him to blow the Second Blast. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "When I was sent, I was sent to the Bearer of the Trumpet. He gestured with it to his mouth, placed one foot forward and the other back, waiting for when he will be commanded to blow. So beware of the Blast [an-nafkha]."
